messages.content: I would like to conduct an interview without having problems

It sounds like having a smooth interview process is important to you. Can you tell me more about the specific challenges or problems you've encountered in interviews in the past that you would like to avoid in the future?
well sometimes the initial question doesn't get asked it just starts recording my voice

I see, it sounds like the interview process can sometimes skip the initial question and jump straight into recording your voice. How do you feel when that happens? Does it make you feel less prepared or affect the flow of the interview in any way?
I think sometimes it does have an effect on the interview itself I can't tell you I'm updating this right now

It sounds like the issue of the initial question not being asked properly impacts the flow and effectiveness of the interview for you. When you say it has an effect on the interview itself, can you elaborate on how it specifically affects your experience as an interviewee? Does it make you feel less engaged or confident during the interview process?

it's frustrating because I really need this to work today so we got to figure it out we got it figured out but you know it's interesting I started this one in the test environment on the test URL and it works perfect there was no audio you're recording my voice you're asking questions everything is going perfect but I did not and then I want to turn it down the session and monitor through the session ID ABCD 4f - 4104 - 4

It sounds like testing the interview process in a controlled environment on a test URL worked perfectly for you without any issues. Can you share more about what specifically was different in the test environment that made the process smooth and error-free compared to when you conducted the actual interview? Were there specific features or settings that made a difference in your experience?

I don't know if it's the settings that doesn't seem to be any initial like asking permission to use my recordings that's been done so there's some check that it does on the other remote interview that's not happening on this debug underscore interview underscore Flo this thing's working great

It seems like the issue with the initial question not being asked may be related to the permission settings for recording during the interview process. When you mentioned that there's a check on the other remote interview that's not happening on this debug interview, can you explain more about what kind of permission checks or prompts you find helpful or essential in ensuring a smooth and successful interview experience? How do these permissions impact your overall comfort and confidence during the interview process?

It seems like we've been discussing some technical aspects related to the interview process and the importance of permissions in ensuring a smooth experience. Moving forward, I'm curious to know more about your preferences when it comes to the format of the interview questions. Do you have a preference for open-ended questions versus closed-ended questions? And how do you feel the type of questions asked can impact the depth of your responses and overall engagement during the interview?

It's great to hear that you like a particular aspect of the interview process. Can you share more about what specifically you enjoy about that part? How does it contribute to your overall experience or make the interview more effective for you?

It's great to hear that you like a particular part of the interview process. Could you share more about what specifically you appreciate or find beneficial about that part? Understanding what aspects you enjoy can help us focus on enhancing those elements to create a more positive experience overall.
okay there are three thinkings going on at the same time and that's not really good
so I'm going to stop this and send it off so

transcript:
Participant: I would like to conduct an interview without having problems

Moderator: It sounds like having a smooth interview process is important to you. Can you tell me more about the specific challenges or problems you've encountered in interviews in the past that you would like to avoid in the future?

Participant: well sometimes the initial question doesn't get asked it just starts recording my voice

Moderator: I see, it sounds like the interview process can sometimes skip the initial question and jump straight into recording your voice. How do you feel when that happens? Does it make you feel less prepared or affect the flow of the interview in any way?

Participant: I think sometimes it does have an effect on the interview itself I can't tell you I'm updating this right now

Moderator: It sounds like the issue of the initial question not being asked properly impacts the flow and effectiveness of the interview for you. When you say it has an effect on the interview itself, can you elaborate on how it specifically affects your experience as an interviewee? Does it make you feel less engaged or confident during the interview process?

Participant: it's frustrating because I really need this to work today so we got to figure it out we got it figured out but you know it's interesting I started this one in the test environment on the test URL and it works perfect there was no audio you're recording my voice you're asking questions everything is going perfect but I did not and then I want to turn it down the session and monitor through the session ID ABCD 4f - 4104 - 4

Moderator: It sounds like testing the interview process in a controlled environment on a test URL worked perfectly for you without any issues. Can you share more about what specifically was different in the test environment that made the process smooth and error-free compared to when you conducted the actual interview? Were there specific features or settings that made a difference in your experience?

Participant: I don't know if it's the settings that doesn't seem to be any initial like asking permission to use my recordings that's been done so there's some check that it does on the other remote interview that's not happening on this debug underscore interview underscore Flo this thing's working great

Moderator: It seems like the issue with the initial question not being asked may be related to the permission settings for recording during the interview process. When you mentioned that there's a check on the other remote interview that's not happening on this debug interview, can you explain more about what kind of permission checks or prompts you find helpful or essential in ensuring a smooth and successful interview experience? How do these permissions impact your overall comfort and confidence during the interview process?

Participant: say something

Participant:  I do like that part

Participant:  I do like that part

Moderator: It seems like we've been discussing some technical aspects related to the interview process and the importance of permissions in ensuring a smooth experience. Moving forward, I'm curious to know more about your preferences when it comes to the format of the interview questions. Do you have a preference for open-ended questions versus closed-ended questions? And how do you feel the type of questions asked can impact the depth of your responses and overall engagement during the interview?

Moderator: It's great to hear that you like a particular aspect of the interview process. Can you share more about what specifically you enjoy about that part? How does it contribute to your overall experience or make the interview more effective for you?

Moderator: It's great to hear that you like a particular part of the interview process. Could you share more about what specifically you appreciate or find beneficial about that part? Understanding what aspects you enjoy can help us focus on enhancing those elements to create a more positive experience overall.
